meanings.definition: To continuously toss and catch objects in the air, typically for entertainment.
meanings.sent1: She loves to juggle colorful balls at the circus.
meanings.sent2: He can juggle three balls effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to juggle with eggs, but they kept breaking!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to juggle tasks is like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: Watching him juggle knives was both thrilling and nerve-wracking.

meanings.definition: To handle multiple tasks or responsibilities skillfully.
meanings.sent1: As a parent, she has to juggle work and family.
meanings.sent2: He can juggle work deadlines like a pro.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle cooking, cleaning, and work left her exhausted.
meanings.sent4: She managed to juggle all her commitments without dropping any.
meanings.sent5: His ability to juggle various projects simultaneously is impressive.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or deceive in a clever way.
meanings.sent1: The magician used sleight of hand to juggle the cards.
meanings.sent2: She tried to juggle the facts to make herself look innocent.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to juggle the truth, but his lies were transparent.
meanings.sent4: The con artist could juggle people's emotions to get what he wanted.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to juggle the situation to her advantage was uncanny.
